events.name: Next ’17 Extended - Aalborg
events.description:
Google Next ‘17 was the largest event in Google’s history. Google Cloud engineers, customers and partners gathered for inspiration and hands on experiences with tools, technologies and services born in the Cloud, including the latest developments from Google Cloud Platform, G Suite, Maps and Devices. Therefore we are organising an extended event here in Aalborg.

Following is a short discerption from Google about keynote session:

"Next '17 is a unique opportunity to hear from the Google leaders who are helping define the future of the cloud, including Diane Greene, SVP of Google Cloud; Urs Hölzle, SVP of Technical Infrastructure, Google Cloud; Brian Stevens, VP of Cloud Platforms and Prabhakar Raghavan, VP of Apps, to name a few.

In addition, we're excited that Sundar Pichai, CEO of Google and Eric Schmidt, Executive Chairman of Alphabet will be sharing their vision in keynotes at Next."

Agenda:

09:30: Registration.

10:00: Opening - Linda Lawton, Google Developer Expert for Google Analytics.

10:30: Keynotes from Next ‘17.

12:15: Open discussion.

12:45: Food and networking.

13:30: IOT at Xtel - Martin Jørgensen, Xtel Wireless.

13:45: Indoor navigation solution - Sigrid Boesen, MapsPeople

14:00: Sponsors pitch.

14:30: Codelab Google Cloud - Jean-Baptiste Lab, GDG Aalborg.

PS: The Codelab session  will require laptops (duration: 2 hours), free accounts will have a value of 300$, and it starts from scratch so upfront knowledge on google cloud is not needed to attend.

events.name: Google I/O Extended Aalborg 2017
events.description:
Only subscription through that link will be considered,

For the 5th year running MapsPeople and BrainsBusiness invite Developers, Students, IT Managers, Nerds and all other Google Enthusiasts to the coolest IT event in Aalborg - GOOGLE I/O EXTENDED.

The event will kick off with a Google inspired Codelab where you as a developer have the chance to get your hands on some of the latest technology – and as always, the event will peak with our live streaming of the keynote from Google I/O 2017 straight from the Shoreline Amphitheatre Mountain View, California. 

We are happy to announce this year's I/O Extended codelab:

Mapping the New York City Subway

Store locators are an often required component of any commercial website that wants to encourage users to visit bricks and mortar stores. In this codelab you'll build a website that serves location data, and scales automatically, thanks to the power of Google App Engine. We show you how to expose an easily navigable visualization of the NYC subway using Google Maps JavaScript API.

What you'll build

In this codelab, you'll build a visualization for the NYC Subway Station dataset that is:

Scalable - you'll use Google App Engine to automatically scale your serving capability to match request load. Maintainable - you'll use the Go programming language to make the back end code simple, reliable, and efficient. Customizable - you'll style the map using the styling capability of the Google Maps JavaScript API, with the help of Google Maps Style Wizard.

There are no more available spaces for the Codelab - if you wish to participate, sign up for our waiting list in the registration form. We will contact you if a space becomes available for you. 

The Codelab will be run by Matt Toon, Sales Engineer at Google and the MapsPeople Development Team.

Google I/O Extended 2017 will be held at the CREATE building at Aalborg University, which holds up to 250 people, so be sure to register today.

PROGRAMME

14:00: Codelab: Mapping the New York City Subway (FULLY BOOKED - WAITING LIST APPLIES)

16:00: Registration - for everyone not participating in the Codelab

16:30: Food and networking

17:15: Group Photo

17:30: Welcome - MapsPeople

17:45: Google Developer Group Aalborg - A short introduction

18:00: Opening - Pablo de la Horra, Google

18:15: Sponsor pitches

18:35: Short break - get a coke and some popcorn

19:00: Keynote - Live streaming from Shoreline Amphitheatre Mountain View, California

20:30 - 22:00: Afterparty.

We reserve the right to make changes to the programme.

events.name: Firebase Functions hands on code
events.description:
GDG Aalborg in partnership with BrainsBusiness invites you to attend our next event, this time, the main theme is Firebase, 

Google is sending Carlos Azaustre and Paola García from Chefly Madrid, Spain to Aalborg to perform two sessions of Firebase codelab. They will be starting from scratch so a basic programming level is enough, the second codelab a basic android knowledge is great.

We have limited number of seats so please reserve only if you are attending.

PS: it is mandatory to signup here before the 21st.

Agenda:

14:00: Registration (Get your cool Swags).

14:30: Opening - Jean-Baptiste Lab, Google Developer Group Aalborg.

14:45: Introduction to Firebase - Linda Lawton, Google Developer Expert.

15:00: Codelab: Firebase cloud functions - Carlos Azaustre, CTO at Chefly Madrid, Spain

16:45: Food and networking

17:15 - 19:00: Codelab: Friendly chat Firebase Android with cloud functions for Android - Paola García, CEO at Chefly Madrid, Spain

events.name: GDD Europe 2017 Extended – Aalborg
events.description:
Join us September 5th for Google Developer Days Europe Extended Aalborg, we are going to watch a live streaming from Krakow and find out the latest Google tech news and will have enough food. 

Google Developer Days (GDD) are global events showcasing the latest developer products and platforms from Google to help you quickly develop high quality apps, grow & retain an active user base, and tap into tools to earn more.  

Schedule:

09:45 - 10:00 : Check-in : pickup your T-shirt

10:00 - 11:00  Google Developer Days Keynote, Tilke Judd, Jason Titus, Tal Oppenheimer, Francis Ma, Sara Robinson: Hear about the latest news and updates to Google's developer products and platforms.

11:00 - 11:30 Break

11:30 - 12:15 What's up with TensorFlow, Internet of Things, and the Google Assistant, Dave Smith

Google has a wide range of new platforms and tools to support computing anywhere and everywhere. Learn how Android Things can be used to simplify the development and production of IoT devices. Hear how the Google Assistant enables users to have conversations with your Actions. See how Android phones, Android Wear, and Android Auto allow users to interact with your service anytime and anywhere. Study how TensorFlow can be used to make machine learning really easy in all kinds of IoT applications, beyond mobile.

12:15 - 13:00

Android Things: The IoT Platform for Everyone,

Rebecca Franks:

Android Things is Google’s Internet of Things platform that is based off the Android operating system. In this presentation, Rebecca will be covering the basics of getting started with the platform and how any developer without electronics experience can build IoT apps with Android Things. A few use cases and examples will be shown in this session, along with how you can use the existing Android libraries with your next IoT project.

13:00 - 13:30 Food and networking

See you there.

events.name: Time To Get Social!
events.description:
Dear All,
It has been a while, we were a bit busy with the Administrative procedures for registering GDG Aalborg.
Now as we are done, we would love to invite you for a social time, on Friday October 20th 17:30 in the Irish house, you are all welcome to join, and get to know each other.

events.name: Google I/O Extended 2018 - Aalborg
events.description:
Google I/O Extended 2018 - Aalborg

Feel the magic of the world's biggest developer conference!

It’s here! The event Developers, Students, IT Managers, techies and Google enthusiasts all over the world have been waiting for: Get ready for Google I/O Extended 2018.

Last year we gave you one of the biggest I/O Extended events in Europe but this year it will be even bigger and better when Google Developer Group, BrainsBusiness and MapsPeople invite you to the biggest I/O Extended event in Europe.

Google Developer Group kicks the day off with a Google-inspired codelab that gives developers a chance to get their hands in some of the latest technology. Later, it all culminates in our live streaming of the keynote from Google I/O 2018 straight from the Shoreline Amphitheatre Mountain View, California.

https://youtu.be/jpqXyRfmXUI

PROGRAMME

14:00: Codelab: Machine Learning - Google Developer Expert Vadim Markovtsev got you covered when we get into deep recurrent neural network

16:00: Registration - for everyone not participating in the Codelab

16:30: Food and networking – try out one of many activities like climbing, VR 3D painting or daring parkour

17:15: Group Photo – make sure to put on your Google I/O t-shirt and crack a smile

17:30: Welcome – back for the 6th year in row MapsPeople are ready to welcome you to Google I/O Extended - Aalborg

18:00: Opening - Daniel Seifert, Google Maps, München, is here to get you properly introduced to Google Maps – don’t miss this

18:15: Sponsor pitches – get to know the local community that made this event possible – thank you!

18:45: Short break - get a coke and some popcorn

19:00: Live streaming from Shoreline Amphitheatre Mountain View, California – what we’ve all been waiting for since last year

20:30 - 22:00: Afterparty – fill your glass, get talking – it’s time to have fun!

We reserve the right to make changes to the programme.
*** Important note ***
In order to reserve your seat, please signup here:
https://goo.gl/MCtZQK

events.name: DevFest 2018 Aalborg
events.description:
It’s here! The Google Developers Fest. Students, IT Managers, Designers, Developers and Google enthusiasts in the world have been waiting for #DevFest18.
And this year we brought it to Aalborg!

GDG Aalborg invites you all to join our #DevFest2018 on 10th and 11th of November.
We are excited to organize the first #DevFest in Aalborg, agenda with various activities and interesting guest-speakers! The venue will be packed with different activities and we will make sure you won't feel hungry or thirsty during the two days event.

We will kick the day off with another machine learning codelab giving developers a chance to get hands-on ML coding. If you want to start your first steps with Android, track number 2 will be holding Android for absolute beginners session that should be a perfect start for you.

UI/UX Workshop for designer will be held on the second day as well as a Google Cloud Platform for beginners code lab.

What to expect from #DevFestAalborg2018 ?

2 Confirmed Google Developer Experts speakers and codelab mentors.
A 24-hour hackathon, 4 codelabs and different tech talks.
Opportunity to network with professionals from the field.
We will cover different topics such as Android, UI/UX, Machine Learning, Maps and Google Cloud Platform, you will have the opportunity to hear much more about today's technologies from experienced developers.

IMPORTANT:
REGISTRATION FOR CODELABS AND HACKATHON WILL REQUIRE BOTH A REGISTRATION HERE AS WELL AS IN GOOGLE FORMS, LINKS BELLOW.

Agenda

10th November (Saturday)

9:30-10:00 Check-in for Codelab Participants, signup is required, here (https://goo.gl/hbZWYf) for the following code labs:
10:00-13:00 Machine learning: Running and training deep neural networks with TensorFlow.js with Vadim Markovtsev.
10:00-13:00 Android for absolute beginners Codelab with Jean-Baptiste Lab.
12:30-13:00 Registration for everyone not participating in the Code Lab
13:00- 13:30 Food and Networking
13:30- 14:00 Sponsor pitches: Get to know the local community that made this event possible – thank you!
14:00- 14:30 Opening
14:30 - 15:00 Vadim Markovtsev: TensorFlow.js How does it work? What are the current limitations? Examples?
15:00- 15:15 Short break
15:15 - 15:45 Matti Jensen: Indoor navigation built on Google Maps.
15:45 - 16:15 Christian Christensen: Designing Progressive Web Apps for an enhanced User Experience and a high ROI.
16:15 Hackathon Start, information and signup, here(https://goo.gl/4sZ4fe):

11th November (Sunday)

9:30-10:00 Registration for Code Lab Participants, signup is required, here (https://goo.gl/H5ysTU) for the following code labs:
10:00 - 12:00 UI/UX: Meaningful UI animation Workshop with Valerija Trane
10:00 - 12:00 Google Cloud platform: Introduction to Kubernetes Codelab with Javier Provecho
12:00 - 12:30 Food and Networking
12:30 - 13:00 Jean-Baptiste Lab: What is Android, its general architecture and how to develop for it.
13:00 - 13:30 Javier Provecho: Improving scheduling decisions in Kubernetes
13:30 - 13:45 Break
13:45 - 14:45 Hackathon Presentations
14:45 - 15:00 Judging / Break
15:00 Hackathon Winner Announcement
15:30 Closing of DevFest 2018 Aalborg

We reserve the right to make changes to the program.

After DevFest and before we put hands on Flutter Viewing party, Time for some team building activities.
We will have other communities joining us and together we will
go fo bowling and have our Christmas dinner with different communities in Aalborg.
Agenda:
16:00 - 17:00 : Team building activities
17:00 - 17:50 : Board games
18:00 - 19:00: Let's play Bowling!
19:00 - 20:30: GDG Aalborg Christmas dinner!
21:00: After party

events.name: Flutter Viewing party
events.description:
Together with F-klubben and FixD, we would like to invite you all to be part of a viewing party for Flutter - Google’s new Mobile App SDK!

On December 4th at 4:30 PM, we will be hosting Flutter Live at the Department of Computer Science at Aalborg University where Google will share a variety of news and updates about Flutter. We would love for you all to be part of it.

In addition to the live session, we are currently in the process of organising a set of Tech Talks - three 30 minute Tech talks given by companies and tech experts about a specific technology they love to use. After the Tech Talks, and before the live session, there will be an opportunity for networking and food.

The event is free of charge, and everyone is invited. Registration will close at 80 attendees. You can register through here.

We will be updating this page periodically with news, schedules, and more.

Be a part of the celebration and join us in a live viewing party on December 4th!
Also, if you are interested in Flutter, please take a look at it here: https://flutter.io

Agenda:

16:30 - 16:45: Registration
16:45 - 17:00: Sponsor pitches
17:00 - 17:30: Jean-Baptiste Lab, Senior software developer at Xtel GDG Aalborg: Google Maps API for Android
17:30 - 18:00: Break and refreshments
18:00 - 18:30: Kais Segni GDG Aalborg, Senior software developer at Xtel : Google Maps API for iOS
18:30 - 19:00: Simone Dyhr Johansen Senior UX consultant at Duckwise ApS
19:00 - 19:30: Food and networking
19:30-21:00 : Keynotes: You will hear directly from the Flutter team, external partners, and other Googlers with demos, technical content, and updates.
events.how_to_find_us: In the lecture hall - through the main entrance and to the left.

Entrance: Free

14:00 14:30 George Jordanov -Google Cloud Platform - kubernetes/docker
14:30 14:45 Coffee break
14:45 16:15 Marek Červinka - Flutter codelab - Beginner friendly
16:15 16:20 Closing

events.name: Google I/O Extended 2019 - Aalborg
events.description:
YOU NEED TO SIGN UP ON THE OFFICIAL EVENT PAGE: http://www.brainsbusiness.dk/dk/arrangementer/brainsbusiness-arrangementer/google-io-extended-2019---aalborg.htm

This Meet up is to confirm your attendance and ensure some of the popular Google Swag!!

Feel the magic of the world's biggest developer conference!

Coming soon! The event Developers, Students, IT Managers, techies and Google enthusiasts all over the world have been waiting for: Get ready for Google I/O Extended 2019.

Last year we gave you the biggest I/O Extended events in Europe but this year it will be even bigger and better when MapsPeople, BrainsBusiness, and GDG Aalborg invite you to the biggest I/O Extended event in Europe.

Preliminary agenda - may be subject to change

We will start the day off with Google-inspired codelabs that gives developers a chance to get their hands in some of the latest technology. We'll also pack the venue with loads of different activities and make sure you won't go hungry or thirsty. Later in the day, it all culminates in our live streaming of the keynote from Google I/O 2019 straight from the Shoreline Amphitheatre Mountain View, California.

Relive the highlights of Google I/O Extended 2018 below - or explore our photo gallery on facebook.

Tomorrow we have a LIMITED number of SWAGS, so first come, first served. See you!!!!

events.name: Google Cloud Platform
events.description:
At the end of this 4 hours course, participants will be able to:
Get hands-on practice with the Google Cloud Platform’s fundamental tools and services.
Understand how Qwiklabs platform works for personal practice

Audience:
You will come in with little or no prior cloud knowledge, and come out with practical experience that you can apply to your first GCP project
Application​ ​developers, Web Developers,​ ​Cloud​ ​Solutions Architects,​ ​DevOps​ ​Engineers,​ ​IT managers
Individuals​ ​using​ ​Google​ ​Cloud​ ​Platform to​ ​create​ ​new​ ​solutions​ ​or​ ​to​ ​integrate existing​ ​systems, application environments,​​​ ​and​ ​infrastructure​ ​with the​ ​Google​ ​Cloud​ ​Platform

Prerequisites
As an attendee, we recommend that you meet these prerequisites:
Assumes little to no prior knowledge in cloud computing or with the Google Cloud Platform. It is expected that students have an information technology or computing background, and have some hands-on familiarity with administering computing systems. Prior work with shell environments / command line interfaces will be helpful for completing the labs in this series.

This is a 5 hours training starting from 14:30 to 19:30
14:30 pm: Registration and refreshments
14:45: Sponsor pitches
15:00: A Tour of Qwiklabs and GCP and Getting Started with Cloud Shell & gcloud
16:00: Introduction to Container Registry
17:00: Break
17:15: Introduction to API at Google
18:15: Cloud IAM: Qwik Start
19:15: Workshop close

About the trainer:
Abdallah is part of the Developer Relations team at Google helping to drive developers success and awareness of the Open Standards & Google Technologies by working closely with Developer Communities. A third Palestinian, a third Kenyan and a third Spanish, he loves strongly typed programming languages, Free & Open Source Software, maths, chess, hiking and a good morning run! You can find him on Twitter at @aabedraba

events.name: Machine learning on Google Cloud
events.description:
This workshop will cover from beginners to in-depth content on Machine Learning on Google Cloud.

Starting from an introductory level, we will be advancing in difficulty with the succeeding sessions. Attendees will be able to take training material home and continue from there with support.

Agenda
ML EVENT
This is a 5 hours training starting from 14:30 to 19:30:
14:30: Registration and refreshments
14:45: Sponsor pitches
15:00: A tour of Qwiklabs and GCP and getting started with Cloud Shell & gcloud
16:00: Cloud Natural Language API: Qwik Start + Video Intelligence: Qwik Start
17:00: Break
17:15: Classify Images of Cloud Using Cloud ML API
18:15: Implementing an AI Chatbot with Dialogflow
19:15: Workshop close

PS: We reserve the right to update the Agenda.

About the trainer:
Abdallah is part of the Developer Relations team at Google helping to drive developers success and awareness of the Open Standards & Google Technologies by working closely with Developer Communities. A third Palestinian, a third Kenyan and a third Spanish, he loves strongly typed programming languages, Free & Open Source Software, maths, chess, hiking and a good morning run! You can find him on Twitter at @aabedraba

events.name: Communities gathering and drinks together
events.description:
We would love to enjoy the last days of the summer with all GDG organizers they really worked hard to plan all our events this year.
Tech allies organizers from F-Klubben and Fixed from Aalborg university, we had a great flutter viewing party together.
Finally the new associations we just joined at International house of Denmark.
We invites you for drinks and bowling,
Let's get inspiration for the future events, learn from other communities’ experiences and develop new ideas...

events.name: Flutter Study Jam
events.description:
GDG Aalborg invites you all to join our #FlutterStudyJam Aalborg on 21st, 22nd and 23rd of February.
We are excited to organize the first Flutter hackathon in Aalborg. The venue will be packed with different activities and we will make sure you won't feel hungry or thirsty during the three days event.

Flutter is Google’s mobile SDK to produce apps for both mobile platforms Android and iOS, and Web.

What to expect from #FlutterStudyJam?

5 Confirmed Flutter Experts to help you starting your flutter journey.
A hackathon, 4 codelabs and 2 talks.
Opportunity to network with professionals from the field.
We will cover different parts of Flutter from hello world to testing your app, UI/UX with Flutter, architecture Rest Api’s etc.
You will have the opportunity to hear much more about Flutter technology from experienced developers.

IMPORTANT:
REGISTRATION FOR CODELABS AND HACKATHON WILL REQUIRE BOTH A REGISTRATION THROUGH MEETUP AS WELL AS IN THE GOOGLE FORMS BELLOW.
CODELABS SIGN-UP FORM: https://bit.ly/37Un4YL

HACKATHON SIGN- UP FORM: https://bit.ly/2OnLqSS

AGENDA

21st February (Friday)

16:30-17:00 Registration
17:00-19:00 Codelab #1: Flutter for absolute beginners with Kais Segni
19:00-19:30 Networking and introduction to the event

22nd February (Saturday)

09:00-09:30 Registration and check-in

10:00-11:30 Codelab #2: Welcome to the Wonderful World of Widgets with Jeroen Meijer.
11:30-12:00 Sponsor pitches: Get to know the local community that made this event possible – thank you!

15:45: Hackathon teams registration

21:00 Snacks

23rd February (Sunday)

08:50 - 09:20 Breakfast for the hackathon's participants

organizers.name: GDG A.
organizers.bio: Disclaimer: GDG Aalborg is an independent group; our activities and the opinions expressed on this meetup group or ur +page should in no way be linked to Google, the corporation.

group_profile.intro: GDG Aalborg (Google developer group Aalborg) is a public and open group for google tech enthusiastic where the purpose is to to learn about Google Techs and Tools for developers to see what local companies and developers are doing with these techs.
